alert.note: Alert for Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Closely monitoring strong to severe thunderstorm that are expected to move into portions of West Feliciana and Pointe Coupee Parishes, and Wilkinson County... At 615 PM CDT, We were tracking a few severe thunderstorms were moving through portions of Avoyelles and Catahoula parishes, moving east-southeast at 40 mph. Right now there is not threat but within the next hour we anticipate these storms to begin to move into Wilkinson County and possibly northern portions of Pointe Coupee Parish. These storms have had a history of producing large hail with some reports from earlier storms close to tennis ball size. Locations impacted include... New Roads, St. Francisville, Centreville, Livonia, Woodville, Fordoche, Morganza, Wakefield, Spillman, Batchelor, Erwinville, Lettsworth, Fort Adams, Dolorosa, Lottie and Crosby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Mississippi.
